A 45-year-old man is seen in the clinic for a follow-up appointment after his recent myocardial infarction. He has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and smoking. A 55-year-old male with a history of heart failure is undergoing an evaluation for a potential cardiac transplant. options.label: D

The values indicate the odds ratio and the 95% confidence interval. How many risk factors may be ascertained from the statistical analysis of the research?

A fetus with intrauterine growth restriction was born prematurely with jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, microcephaly, and diffuse petechiae at birth. A brain CT was done which is shown below. What is the best method for the diagnosis of the etiological agent?

12-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for evaluation of muscle weakness. The patient has a history of seizures. Examination shows decreased strength in the upper and lower extremities on the left compared to the right. Laboratory evaluation shows increased serum lactate levels both after exercise and at rest. His older sister is affected by the same disorder, but she displays very few symptoms. Which of the following is the most likely pedigree chart in the following?
When do you consider administering epinephrine in a neonate during resuscitation?

options.label: A
options.text: Heart rate remains at < 60 beats/minute despite effective compressions and ventilations.

options.label: B
options.text: Heart rate remains at < 100 beats/minute despite effective compressions and ventilations.

options.label: C
options.text: Heart rate does not improve after 30 seconds with bag and mask ventilation.

options.label: D
options.text: Infants with severe respiratory depression fail to respond to positive-pressure ventilation via bag and mask.

questions.correct_answer: A. Heart rate remains at < 60 beats/minute despite effective compressions and ventilations.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Heart rate remains at < 60 beats/ minutes despite effective compression and ventilation

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with a history of urinary tract infections is seen in the clinic for routine follow-up. Her current medications include a prophylactic antibiotic for recurrent UTIs. Recent laboratory tests reveal an isolated increase in serum creatinine from her baseline, with no other abnormalities. She is asymptomatic, with normal blood pressure and no signs of fluid overload or dehydration. Her glomerular filtration rate (GFR) is estimated to be within normal limits based on her cystatin C levels. Which of the following medications is most likely responsible for the isolated increase in her serum creatinine level without an actual change in GFR?

A 25-year-old patient presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of blurred vision and difficulty focusing on distant objects. Upon examination, the ophthalmologist diagnoses the patient with simple myopic astigmatism. Which of the following would be prescribed for simple myopic astigmatism?

A 60-year-old male patient was diagnosed with atrial fibrillation with a controlled ventricular rate. The medication charts reveal that he was taking digoxin, potassium chloride, clarithromycin, atenolol, and triamterene. Suspecting the symptoms to be due to digoxin overdose, plasma levels of digoxin were ordered. It was found that his blood levels of digoxin have increased significantly. Which of his medications is most likely responsible for this increase in digoxin levels?

A 65-year-old male with a past medical history significant for hypertension and coronary artery disease presents to the emergency department complaining of acute onset shortness of breath and chest pain. The patient describes the chest pain as sharp and worsening with deep breaths. His vital signs on presentation are within normal limits, but he appears to be in respiratory distress. Physical examination reveals muffled heart sounds. An electrocardiogram (ECG) is performed, demonstrating low voltage QRS complexes and electrical alternans. A chest X-ray (CXR) is also obtained. Based on the clinical presentation and initial diagnostic tests, which of the following is the most likely finding on auscultation?

options.label: B
options.text: Dull note on right lower chest

options.label: D
options.text: Hyper-resonant note on right lower chest

questions.text: A 31-year-old woman, gravida 3 para 2, at 40 weeks gestation is in active labor. The patient has had a normal prenatal course. Her first pregnancy was an uncomplicated term vaginal delivery. Her second pregnancy ended with an emergent cesarean delivery for a nonreassuring fetal heart rate pattern. Spontaneous rupture of the membranes occurred 15 minutes ago with blood-tinged amniotic fluid. Blood pressure is 124/76 mm Hg, pulse is 78/ min, and respirations are 18/min. On pelvic examination, the cervix is 6 cm dilated and 80% effaced, and the fetal presenting part is at +1 station. The fetal heart rate tracing is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this fetal heart rate pattern?

A 30-year-old male with a progressive increase in dyspnea over the past five years presents for evaluation. He reports no significant past medical history but mentions that his younger brother has similar respiratory complaints. Physical examination reveals decreased breath sounds throughout all lung fields. A chest X-ray shows a flattened diaphragm and increased lucency in all lung fields, suggestive of hyperinflation. Pulmonary function tests reveal a decreased forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) and an increased forced vital capacity (FVC). Which of the following is the most likely mechanism underlying his pulmonary pathology?

A 32-year-old pregnant woman presents to a tertiary care center at 26 weeks of gestation for a routine antenatal check-up. She has been generally feeling fatigued over the past few weeks with occasional palpitations. Her obstetric history is unremarkable, and she has been adherent to her prenatal vitamins. On examination, she appears pale. Laboratory tests reveal a hemoglobin level of 9.8 g/dl, indicating moderate anemia. The healthcare provider considers the Anemia Mukt Bharat initiative guidelines to formulate an appropriate management plan, taking into account the potential challenges of treatment compliance and the gestational age at which anemia has been diagnosed. Given the patient's clinical presentation and the Anemia Mukt Bharat initiative guidelines, which of the following management strategies is most appropriate for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Prescribe two tablets of Iron and Folic Acid (IFA) containing 60 mg elemental Iron and 500 mcg Folic Acid each, taken orally once daily, with close monitoring of hemoglobin levels and patient adherence to treatment.

options.label: B
options.text: Initiate Intravenous (IV) Iron Sucrose therapy as the primary treatment, considering the moderate severity of anemia and the potential for rapid correction before delivery.

options.label: C
options.text: Recommend two IFA tablets daily and consider the addition of IV Iron Sucrose or Ferric Carboxy Maltose (FCM) if there is evidence of non-compliance or insufficient response to oral therapy by the next follow-up visit.

options.label: D
options.text: Directly opt for Intramuscular (IM) Ferric Carboxy Maltose (FCM) administration, bypassing oral supplementation, to ensure rapid improvement in hemoglobin levels.

questions.correct_answer: C. Recommend two IFA tablets daily and consider the addition of IV Iron Sucrose or Ferric Carboxy Maltose (FCM) if there is evidence of non-compliance or insufficient response to oral therapy by the next follow-up visit.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Recommend two IFA tablets daily and consider the addition of IV Iron Sucrose or Ferric Carboxy Maltose (FCM) if there is evidence of non-compliance or insufficient response to oral therapy by the next follow-up visit.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statements: MODY3 is a defect in HNF1A N-acetyl cysteine acts by replenishing stores of intrahepatic glutathione Xeroderma pigmentosa is a defect in base excision repair Defective fumaryl-acetoacetate hydrolase enzyme is associated with type 2 tyrosinemia

A 60-year-old man with a history of peptic ulcer disease presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, distension, and vomiting for the past 24 hours. He reports that the pain started suddenly and has been getting progressively worse. He has not had a bowel movement or passed gas in over 12 hours. On examination, the patient appears to be in severe distress, with a distended and tender abdomen. He has a fever of 39°C, and his blood pressure is low at 90/60 mmHg. Blood tests show an elevated white blood cell count. Which of the following would be detrimental in this case?

A patient presented with fever, dyspnea, palpitations, and tachycardia. The echocardiography revealed vegetation in the septal leaflets. Tissue sections from them reveal the following findings as shown in the image. What is the most likely implicated agent?

options.label: A
options.text: Pigmented septate hyphae at 90 degrees, Mucormycosis

options.label: B
options.text: Right angle branching septate hyphae, Fusarium

options.label: D
options.text: Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.correct_answer: D. Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.text: A public health researcher is evaluating various strategies for addressing the high prevalence of cataract-related blindness in rural India. The researcher is particularly interested in the cost-effectiveness and outreach potential of different surgical intervention models. Given the logistical and financial constraints in rural settings, which of the following strategies for cataract surgery is considered the most cost-effective and has been widely adopted across the country?

options.label: A
options.text: Mobile surgical units performing on-site surgeries

options.label: B
options.text: Private clinics offering discounted surgery rates

options.label: C
options.text: NGO organized screening camps followed by surgery at a base hospital

questions.correct_answer: C. NGO organized screening camps followed by surgery at a base hospital
questions.explanation: Ans. C) NGO organized screening camps followed by surgery at a base hospital

questions.text: An inherited disorder of carbohydrate metabolism is characterized by an abnormally increased concentration of hepatic glycogen with normal structure and no detectable increase in serum glucose concentration after oral administration of fructose. These two observations suggest that the disease is a result of the absence of which of the following enzymes?

A 28-year-old research scientist is presenting her findings on monoclonal antibody production using hybridoma technology at an international biotechnology conference. During the question-and-answer session, she explains various aspects of the process, including cell fusion, selection media, and the role of specific enzymes in cell survival. Based on her explanations, which of the following statements she makes about hybridoma technology is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Specific antibody-producing cells are fused with myeloma cells to create hybridomas

options.label: B
options.text: Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium

options.label: C
options.text: Aminopterin, a component of HAT medium, inhibits the denovo pathway of nucleotide synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: HGPRTase and thymidylate synthetase enzymes are necessary for the survival of cells in the salvage pathway

questions.correct_answer: B. Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Myeloma cells in the salvage pathway can grow in HAT medium.

A 45-year-old male with a known history of Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection presents for a follow-up visit. Which of the following histological features is most characteristic of chronic HCV infection?

The presenter discusses a case where a patient alleged civil negligence against a physician, but the lawsuit was not filed within the legally designated period. Dr. Kavita is asked to identify the legal doctrine that bars the case from being opened after this period. Which term correctly identifies this doctrine?
